lesson.title: Groups
lesson.author: the english shelf
lesson.keywords: groups, category, categories, team, game, vocabulary

content.text: Student teams compete to put words into categories and identify categories.
You'll need to prepare a list of categories with a number of example items within each.

Demonstrate the example at the top of the worksheet and get the students to identify a category for the listed items - in this case, the group name is 'fruit'. Put the students into teams and instruct them to copy the words onto their worksheets as you read them out and/or write them on the board and to name the group as soon as they can.

Read out a list of items for each question in turn. Allocate points to the first team to correctly identify each group. The items and categories can get harder as you proceed. After the eight groups are identified, ask the bonus questions. 

An example bonus question might be to related to the last question - for example, if the category was 'Cities', ask the teams to name the country each of the listed cities are in and offer enough bonus points to enable any team to still win.
